intro: Borreria angustifolia var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, lanceolate to ovate leaves that are broader than the typical variety. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the summer months. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
